Definitions

 

"Agreement"

means the signature page, the Term Sheet (Part 1) including any annexes attached thereto, the Terms and Conditions (Part 2), and any other documents incorporated by reference;

“Anti-bribery Legislation”

all anti-bribery and corruption laws applicable to this Agreement;

 

"Charges"

means the applicable charges for the selected Package as set out in the Term Sheet;

"Commencement Date"

means the date specified in the Term Sheet;

“Company Data”

information, data, documents, databases, designs, schedules, instructions, plans specifications, sketches, models, samples, technical information and/or other information written, oral or otherwise of any type relating to the Company Products and disclosed by the Company to TechPassport and/or uploaded by the Company to the Platform;

“Company Products”

Means the products and services uploaded to the Platfrom and offered by the Customer for testing under a POC Contract;

“Computer Virus”

means malware, spyware, trap doors, back doors, time bombs, logic bombs, worms trojan horses and any other parasitic program or programming code written intentionally to enter a computer platform or computer network without the user’s permission or knowledge, which is intended to damage, modify or disrupt the operation of software or hardware;

“Confidential Information”

the POC Contract T&Cs, the POC Contract and any drafts thereof, the existence and contents of this Agreement and any and all information or know how about TechPassport or the Company (including about systems, security, procedures, products, business strategy, facilities, people, disputes under this Agreement) in whatever form, whether tangible or intangible, and whether disclosed before or after the date of this Agreement;

 

“Customer”

a third-party using the Platform as a potential customer of the Company’s products and/or services;

 

“Customer Data”

information, data, documents, databases, designs, schedules, instructions, plans specifications, sketches, models, samples, technical information and/or other information written, oral or otherwise of any type and however disclosed relating to the business activities of the Customer or uploaded to the Platform by the Customer’s authorised users of the platform;  

 

“Company User”

 

Means any user who is authorised by Company to use the Platform on the Company’s behalf;

 

“Data Breach Event”

Any actual or potential Personal Data breach, any breach of the provisions of Clause 13 or any complaint made in relation to the Personal Data;

 

“Data Protection Legislation”

All applicable laws and regulations relating to the processing of Personal Data or other data processed in connection with this Agreement, including, where applicable the national legislation implementing the Data Protection Directive (Directive 95/46/EC) and the Directive on Privacy and Electronic Communications (Directive 2002/58/EC), the GDPR and any other laws and regulations implementing, derogating from or made under them, and any orders and codes of practice, guidelines and recommendations issued by the applicable regulatory authorities, and codes of conduct notified by TechPassport to the Company as applicable, in each case as amended or re-enacted and in force from time to time;

 

“Data Subject”

an individual who is the subject of Personal Data;

 

“Descriptions”

The description of the Company’s products and/or services which it has uploaded or entered on the Platform or within the POC Contract (including POC Contract drafts);

 

“Documentation”

Means any user and/or operating manuals, functional specifications, training materials, guidance, and other user documents or information relating to the Services (or any element thereof) provided by TechPassport, whether in printed or electronic form;

 

“Force Majeure”

any circumstances which occur and which are beyond the reasonable control of a party and directly prevent that party from performing its obligations under this Agreement including war, civil commotion, armed conflict, riot, act of terrorism, fire, flood or other act of God (excluding any labour dispute labour shortages, strikes or lock-outs);

 

“Good Industry Practice”

Means in relation to the provision of the services  provided under this Agreement and any ancillary performance obligations, the provision of such services or the performance of such obligations using the highest degree of skill, care, prudence, supervision, diligence, foresight, quality control and quality management which would (at the relevant time) be adopted by a leading professional supplier of such services;

 

“GDPR”

the EU General Data Protection Regulation 2016/679 of the European Parliament and of the Council;

 

“Initial Term”

The period set out in the Term Sheet;

"IPR"

means all present and future rights conferred by statute, common law or equity in any territory in or in relation to copyright and related moral rights, patent, trade marks, designs, topographies, database rights (and the right to extract information from databases), circuit layouts, business and domain names, inventions, inventions, , rights in goodwill or to sue for passing off and all other similar rights or equivalent rights or forms of protection whether or not registered (or capable of being registered) and all applications (and rights to  apply) therefor, and for renewals and extensions of any such rights as may now or in the future exist anywhere in the world;

“Package”

means a selection of Services as described in the Term Sheet;

 

“Personal Data”

personal data (as defined by the GDPR) in respect of which TechPassport or the Customer is primarily responsible and/or accountable under Data Protection Legislation;

 

“Personal Data Breach”

The accidental or unlawful destruction, loss, alteration, corruption, unauthorised disclosure of, or access to, Personal Data transmitted, stored or otherwise processed;

 

“Platform”

Means:

  1. (a)the software developed and/or used by TechPasport which is deployed on the equipment referred to in paragraph (b) of this definion and made available for access  to Company Users; and 

  2. (b)all computer hardware, software, consumables, operating systems, firmware, telecommunications networking, routing, cabling, power supplies, electrical or other infrastructure equipment that is used as a platform for hosting the Software and Data and which are accessed and used (directly or indirectly) by Users through such equipment. 

“POC Contract”

means a contract between the Company and a Customer for the evaluation of the Company’s products and/or services agreed via the Platform;

“POC Contract T&Cs”

Means the terms and conditions set out in Appendix A to these Terms and Conditions which may be updated from time to time in accordance with clause Changes to Terms and Conditions;

“Services”

means the services relating the applicable Package as described in the Term Sheet and the Documentation;

"Term"

means the term of this Agreement as set out in Appendix 1;

“Term Sheet”

The term sheet in Part 1 of this Agreement; and

“Working Day”

means Monday to Friday inclusive but excluding bank and other public holidays in England and Wales.

Scope

    1. 2.1This Agreement is between TechPassport and the Company and sets out the conditions with respect to the Company’s use of the Services.   

Term

This Agreement shall commence on the Commencement Date and shall, unless terminated earlier, continue until the end of the Initial Term.  At the end of the Initial Term, this Agreement shall renew for successive twelve-month periods unless terminated by either party by giving at least three months’ notice prior to the expiry of the Initial Term or any renewal term, or (ii) by either party in accordance with the terms of the Agreement.

3.2         Termination by the Company in accordance with clause This Agreement shall commence on the Commencement Date and shall, unless terminated earlier, continue until the end of the Initial Term. At the end of the Initial Term, this Agreement shall renew for successive twelve-month periods unless terminated by either party by giving at least three months’ notice prior to the expiry of the Initial Term or any renewal term, or (ii) by either party in accordance with the terms of the Agreement. prior to the expiry of the Initial Term or renewal term as the case may be shall not entitle the Company to a refund of any Charges.  

Use of the Platform

TechPassport grants to the Company:

A non-exclusive, worldwide, royalty-free right to permit Company Users to use the Services and the Documentation for the Term in accordance with the terms and conditions of this Agreement.

Non-exclusive, perpetual, worldwide, irrevocable and royalty-free right for Company to use the Service Outputs in accordance with terms and conditions of this Agreement.

The licence granted under clause TechPassport grants to the Company: is subject to the following:

The Company and the Company Users may only use the Platform and Service Outputs for the Company’s own internal business purposes;

The POC Contract, once signed, is subject to any additional restrictions agreed under the POC Contract and such restrictions shall apply as between the Company and the Customer;

The Company will only use the POC Contract T&Cs for entering into POC Contracts via the Platform and shall not change the POC Contract T&Cs other than the Schedule to the POC Contract;

The Customer Data and IPR in the Services shall only be used by the Company for the purposes of using the Platform to create a POC Contract.  

The number of Company Users shall not exceed the maximum number of Company Users and Product listings set out in the Term Sheet.

 

Any subsidiary or holding company of the Company is required to enter into a separate access agreement before becoming entitled to use the Platform for the purposes of entering into a POC Contract notwithstanding it relates to the evaluation of the same product and/or service offered by the Company via the Platform.

The Company shall be responsible, at its own expense, for its internal and external telecommunications systems, networks, any internet connection, hardware, mobile devices or other systems or other systems or software to access the Platform.  

The Company acknowledges and agrees that the Platform is a multi-tenanted and nothing in this Agreement creates an exclusive supply arrangement or prevents TechPassport from supplying the Services to a third party.  

Password Management and Security

The Company will be identified as a primary account owner for the use of the Services.  The Company may use its primary owner credentials to create other owner accounts, admin accounts and standard user accounts for any Company User.  The Company shall be responsible for creating, modifying and disabling Company User accounts.  The Company shall supply authorised individuals with passports, login details and such other information as may be reasonably required to enable such authorised individual to access and use the Services in the manner contemplated by this Agreement as Company Users.  

The Company shall take adequate organisational measures to ensure that the respective User log-in are used exclusively by the Users.  The Company shall, and shall ensure that Users, keep their respective User password are protected, kept secret and not disclosed to any third party.  The Company shall immediately inform TechPassport if it cbecomes aware of any non-eligible person has access to or knowledge of any passport or accesses the Platfrom.

TechPassport may prevent any person from accessing the platform and may take such adequate measures as TechPassport deems necessary to prevent such access if TechPassport becomes aware of any circumstances which give reason to believe that any User log-ins have been misused.

Company Obligations

The Company shall perform its obligations under this Agreement and use the Services in accordance and compliance with (i) the terms of this Agreement; (ii) TechPassport’s instructions;  and (iii) all applicable laws and regulation (and so as not to do anything that would cause TechPassport or the Customer to be in breach of any applicable laws and regulations).

The Company shall provide TechPassport such information, data and documents as it may reasonably require in order to perform the Services.

Warranties

The Company undertakes, warrants and represents that:

it shall not, and shall procure all Company Users to not, re-transmit, store, sell, deal or transfer, or otherwise make available to any third party the Customer Data and POC Contract T&Cs (other than to Customers who have initiated a POC request) or use for any reason other than as permitted by this Agreement.

it will not attempt to change the POC Contract T&Cs;

It will keep all Company details up to date on the Platform, including registered office address.  

      1. 1.1.1.It will comply with the Platform Acceptable Use Policy;   

it has all necessary authorisations, consents, permissions and/or licences required to enable it to enter into POC Contract for the testing of the Company Products;

the Descriptions accurately describe the relevant Company Products;

it will not use the Platform for any anti-competitive behaviour, bribery or corruption, insider trading, posting defamatory information or any other act or omission which does not comply with applicable law;

perform its obligations under the Agreement in a timely and professional manner and in accordance with Good Industry Practice;

it shall not introduce a Computer Virus on the Platform;

it will comply with industry best IT security practices when administrating log-ins and passwords; and

it shall, at its own expense, procure adequate policies of insurance in respect of the Company’s relevant potential liabilities arising out of or in connection with all POC Contracts it enters into and shall comply with furnish evidence as TechPassport may reasonably request to demonstrate that the insurance has been procured and maintained in force.  

The Company shall indemnify TechPassport against any and all liability, loss, damage, costs (including full legal fees), and other expenses that TechPassport incurs or suffers as a result of any action or claim that is brought against TechPassport arising from the Company’s breach of clause.

Intellectual Property

The Company shall not use the TechPassport name or logo (including any trade marks) in any of its advertising or publicity material without TechPassports prior written consent (which in the case of trade marks shall be by way of separate trade mark licence), which may be withheld or given in TechPassport’s absolute discretion.

The Company Data provided to TechPassport by the Company are and shall remain the Company’s property and TechPassport shall not obtain any right, title or interest in them.

The Company grants to TechPassport the non-exclusive right to use the Company Data to the extent necessary to provide the Services to the Company or Company Group Members.  The Company Data may be viewable to Customers on the Platform and incorporated into the POC Contract which may be used for Customers’ internal business use and record keeping purposes.

Save for the Company Data, the IPR in the Services are and shall remain vested in TechPassport.  

TechPassport shall indemnify the Company against any and all liability, loss, damage, costs (including full legal fees), and other expenses that Company incurs or suffers as a result of any action or claim that is brought against Company arising from its use of any Services under this Agreement provided:

that such use is in accordance with the terms of this Agreement;

the Company notifies TechPassport in writing of any claim of which it has notice;

not make any admission of liability or agree to any settlement or compromise any claim without the prior written consent of TechPassport; and

at TechPassport’s request and expense, give TechPassport all reasonable assistance in connection with the investigation, negotiation and resolution of the claim.

Charges and Payment

The Company shall pay the Charges in accordance with this Clause Charges and Payment and the Term Sheet.

The Company shall pay any undisputed invoices within 30 days of the date of the invoice.

All sums payable under this Agreement exclude value-added tax or any relevant local sales taxes, which the Company shall apply according to relevant local regulations.  TechPassport shall provide a valid value-added tax or local sales tax invoice.

TechPassport shall be entitled to increase the Charges at the expirty of the Initial Period and every twelve months thereafter by a maximum of the amount of the percentage increase in the UK Retail Price Index over the preceding 12 months by providing written notice to the Company.

The Company may upgrade to a higher Package through the Package options on the Platform.  Should the  Company select a higher Package during the Initial Term or any renewal term, the Company shall pay the difference in fees between the lower Package and higher Package for the pro-rated period of the Initial Term or the subsequent renewal term as the case may be.

Liability

Neither party shall be liable to the other in tort (including negligence), breach of contract, breach of statutory duty or otherwise due to, under and/or arising out of or in connection with this Agreement for any loss of profits, revenues, loss of business or anticipated savings (in each cease whether direct or indirect), or for any loss or damage which is consequential, punitive, special or indirect, in each case whether or not it had been advised of the likelihood of any such loss or damage.

Subject to clause No limit on or exclusion of liability shall apply under this Agreement to: (i) claims relating to death or personal injury; (ii) any claims relating to regulatory breaches; (iii) claims of theft, fraud or fraudulent misrepresentation;, the liability of TechPassport to the Company under or in connection with this Agreement whether arising in tort (including negligence), breach of contract, breach of statuory duty or otherwise shall, in aggregate not exceed the greater of:

Five thousand pounds (£5,000.00); and

100% of the Charges paid and payable under this Agreement in the calendar year in which the cause of action arose.

No limit on or exclusion of liability shall apply under this Agreement to:  (i) claims relating to death or personal injury; (ii) any claims relating to regulatory breaches; (iii) claims of theft, fraud or fraudulent misrepresentation; (iv) any breach of the obligations set out in clause Confidentiality (Confidentiality), or any liability under the indemnity granted in clause TechPassport shall indemnify the Company against any and all liability, loss, damage, costs (including full legal fees), and other expenses that Company incurs or suffers as a result of any action or claim that is brought against Company arising from its use of any Services under this Agreement provided: (Intellectual Property Rights) and clause The Company shall indemnify TechPassport against any and all liability, loss, damage, costs (including full legal fees), and other expenses that TechPassport incurs or suffers as a result of any action or claim that is brought against TechPassport arising from the Company’s breach of clause. (Warranties); and (v) any other liability which cannot be lawfully excluded or limited.

Whilst the Platform assists with the creation of the POC Contract, the POC Contract comprises a separate legal agreement between the Company and the Customer and TechPassport has no liability under the POC Contract including with respect to either the Company’s or the Customer’s acts or omissions.  

Neither party shall be liable to the other for any failure to fulfil obligations caused by a Force Majeure Event.

Confidentiality

Each party shall:

Keep confidential all Confidential Information and only use it as necessary to perform this Agreement; and

Only disclose to any third party Confidential Information if expressly permitted by this Agreement and the third party has signed a suitable confidentiality agreement

The foregoing obligations shall not apply however:

to information which is or later comes into the public domain otherwise than through an act or omission of the Recipient; or

to information which was already known to the Recipient at the time of disclosure otherwise by an unauthorised disclosure by a third party; or

where disclosure of information is required by law, order of court, the requirements of any regulatory authority or taxation authority or the rules of any stock exchange; or

where the Recipient has the prior written consent of the Provider to so use or disclose the information.

Each party may disclose information to its employees, professional advisors, agents and subcontractors solely on a need-to-know basis provided that it procures that the person to whom such disclosure is made complies with the obligations under this clause Confidentiality as if it were a party to the Agreement.

Confidential Information comprising the POC negotiations, draft POC Contracts and the signed POC Contract may be disclosed by either party to the relevant Customer.  TechPassport shall procure all Customers accessing the Platform to agree to keep such documents and information confidential as set out in this clause Confidentiality.  

Delay

The Company acknowledges the importance with respect to its timely response to Customers and reviewing and responding to draft POC Contracts on the Platform (“Response”).  The Company shall promptly respond to Customer queries and complete the pre-contract steps in a timely manner.

If the Company becomes aware of any actual or potential delay with respect to issuing any Response it will immediately advise TechPassport.  

The Company shall take all reasonable steps to minimise the impact on the its delay.  

In addition to any other remedy available under the Agreement, TechPassport shall be entitled to suspend or remove the Company and/or any Company Product from the Platform if the Company has not complied with this clause 12.

Termination

Notwithstanding anything else in this Agreement either party may terminate this Agreement by notice in writing to the other party at any time with immediate effect.

Notwithstanding anything else contained in it, this Agreement may be terminated:

by TechPassport immediately by giving notice in writing to the Company if:

  1. i.The Company shall (or shall threaten to) sell, assign, part with or cease to carry on its business or that part of its business relating to the development of the use of the Platform; or 

  2. ii.the control (as defined for the purposes of Section 416 of the Income and Corporation Taxes Act 1988) of the Company shall be transferred to any person or persons other than the person or persons in control of the Company at the date of this Agreement (but the Software Owner shall only be entitled to terminate within the period of 60 days after the Software Owner shall have been notified in writing of the change in control); 

by TechPassport by giving notice in writing to the Company if any of the following occur:

      1. a.i.[INSERT] 

by either party immediately by giving notice in writing to the other if:

      1. a.ii.the other party commits any material or persistent breach of any term of this Agreement and (in the case of a breach capable of being remedied) shall have failed, within fifteen (15) days after the receipt of a request in writing from the other party so to do, to remedy the breach (such request to contain a warning of such party’s intention to terminate); or 

      2. a.iii.the other party has a receiver or administrative receiver appointed of it or over any part of its undertaking or assets or passes a resolution for winding up (otherwise than for the purpose of a bona fide scheme of solvent amalgamation or reconstruction) or a court of competent jurisdiction makes an order to that effect or if the other party enters into any voluntary arrangement with its creditors or becomes subject to an administration order. 

Consequences of Termination

Termination of the Agreement for whatever reason shall not prejudice any accrued rights or liabilities of either party nor shall it affect the coming into force or the continuance in force of any provision hereof which is expressly or by implication intended to come into or continue in force on or after such termination.

Termination of this Agreement shall not affect any POC Contract and POC Contracts shall continue in full force and effect in accordance with its terms and conditions.

Upon termination of this Agreement, the Supplier shall no longer have the right to use the Platform and shall immediately cease all use of:

the Platform; and

all use of the POC T&Cs save for its own record keeping purposes for existing POC Contracts.

Data Protection

Each party warrants in respect of any Personal Data that it may receive, obtain, create or process in connection with the Platform or this Agreement, that it will:

comply with all relevant Data Protection Legislation;

only process Personal Data as strictly necessary for the purposes of this Agreement (and in the case of Customer Personal Data, the Company shall only use such Personal Data for communicating with the Customer for the purposes of entering into a POC Contract, use of the Platform and in accordance with the reasonable instructions of TechPassport and/or the relevant Customer if applicable);

not permit any other party (including any sub-contractor) to process any Personal Data without having obtained prior written consent from the other party;

maintain and to provide to the other party upon request an accurate up-to-date written record of processing activities carried out in respect of Personal Data in a format which meets the requirements of the Data Protection Legislation and the reasonable requirements of the requesting party;

maintain strict and adequate security, technical and organisational measures in accordance with the relevant Data Protection Legislation in order to maintain the integrity and confidentiality of the Personal Data whilst in its possession to ensure that the Personal Data shall not be recorded, processed, deleted, disclosed, lost damaged, altered, used or otherwise tampered with in an unauthorised, accidental or unlawful manner.

The Company warrants in respect of any Personal Data that it may receive, obtain, create or process in connection with the Platform or this Agreement, that it will:

comply with TechPassport’s reasonable instructions with respect to any registration and/or notification requirements, correspondence with any regulatory authority and any communication with a Data Subject;

promptly notify TechPassport in writing if it receives any communication from a Data Subject or a Regulatory Authority regarding the processing of the Personal Data and shall provide co-operation and assistance to TechPassport in respect of the same; and

acknowledges and agrees that any transfer of Customer Personal Data received in connection with a POC is subject to the POC Contract;

In the event of a Data Breach Event the Company shall:

promptly (and in any event within forty-eight (48) hours) notify TechPassport in writing of the Data Breach Event including in such notice all information reasonably required by TechPassport to comply with its obligation under the Data Protection Legislation;  

provide, at the request of TechPassport, co-operation, assistance and/or all information reasonably required by TechPassport to comply with Data Protection Legislation and/or responding to any communication from a Data Subject or regulatory authority;

comply with TechPassport’s reasonable instructions;

provide TechPassport with a copy of all Personal Data it holds in relation to the affected Data Subject(s) upon TechPassport’s request; and

without prejudice to any other right or remedy of TechPassport or Group Company, the Company shall undertake promptly to remedy the breach (or the circumstances giving rise to the breach) without charge and at no additional cost to TechPassport or the Group Company.

The Company shall fully indemnify and keep indemnified TechPassport and Group Companies against all Losses arising out of or in connection with a Data Breach.  Assignment and Contracting.

Anti-Bribery and Corruption

In connection with this Agreement, each party warrants and represents that:

it shall comply with and shall ensure that its Representatives are aware of and comply with Anti-bribery Legislation; and

it, nor to its knowledge, any of its Representatives are, (i) currently under actual or threatened investigation, inquiry or audit by any government authority in relation to any potential offence involving fraud, bribery, corruption or dishonestly, (ii) have been convicted or pleaded guilty to an offence involving fraud, bribery, corruption or dishonesty; or (iii) the target of economic or financial sanctions measures imposed by the United Nations, the European Union, the United Kingdom, the United States or any relevant and applicable jurisdiction; and

it shall not, and shall ensure its Representatives shall not, act or make any omissions that would cause the other party or any Customer to be in violation of any applicable Anti-bribery Legislation.

Assignment

Neither party shall assign any of its rights or obligations under this Agreement without the other party’s prior written consent, not to be unreasonably withheld or delayed.

Changes to Terms and Conditions

TechPassport has the right to change these Terms and Conditions by providing the Company at least thirty (30) days’ notice in writing provided such changes apply all users of the Platform which offer Products for POCs. Upon receipt of such notice, the Company has the right to terminate this Agreement by providing TechPassport with written notice within such thirty day notice period.  If requested by the Company in writing stipulating its nominated bank account, TechPassport shall pay a pro-rated refund for any pre-paid Charges if the effective date of termination is prior to the expiry of the Initial Term or the then-current renewal term.

Relationship and Third Parties

Other than the relevant Customer with respect to Company’s misuse of Customer Data, this Agreement does not create or infer any rights under the Contracts (Rights of Third Parties) Act 1999 which are enforceable by any person who is not a party to this Agreement.

General

Neither party will be liable for delay in performing its obligations or for failure to perform its obligations if the delay or failure results from circumstances beyond its reasonable control and is not attributable to its wilful acts, neglect or failure to take reasonable precautions, including acts of God, governmental action, flood, fire, explosion, accident, war, acts of terrorism or civil commotion.

If either party needs to give the other notice under this agreement it must do so in writing and provide it to the other party at their usual place of business (which will be deemed to have been delivered 48 hours after despatch) or via electronic means  (which  shall be deemed to have been received on the first Working Day following its despatch).

No failure to exercise nor any delay in exercising by any party to this Agreement of any right, power, privilege or remedy under this Agreement shall impair or operate as a waiver thereof.

Nothing in this Agreement shall constitute, or be deemed to constitute, a partnership between the parties nor, except as expressly provided, shall it constitute, or be deemed to constitute, any party the agent of any other party for any purpose.

Any amendment or variation to this Agreement shall only be made by prior written agreement between the parties.

The unenforceability of any single provision of the Agreement shall not affect any other provision thereof. Where such a provision is held to be unenforceable, the parties shall use their best endeavours to negotiate and agree upon an enforceable provision which achieves to the greatest extent possible the economic, legal and commercial objectives of the unenforceable provision.

The headings to the Clauses and sections of these terms and conditions are for ease of reference only and shall not affect the interpretation or construction of the Agreement.

This Agreement and any appendices and documents referred to herein constitutes the entire understanding between the parties with respect to the subject matter hereof and supersedes all prior oral or written communications, agreements or understandings between the parties, save where a fraudulent representation has been made.

In the event of any conflict of inconsistency between the Term Sheet and the Terms and Conditions, the Terms and Conditions shall prevail.

This Agreement may be executed in any number of counterparts, which shall together constitute one Agreement.  Any party may enter into this Agreement by signing any such counterpart. The parties agree and consent to the use of electronic signatures solely for the purposes of executing this Agreement or any variation or related transactional document.  Such electronic signature shall be deemed to have the same full and binding effect as a hand written signature.  

This Agreement This Agreement shall be governed in accordance with English Law and subject to the exclusive jurisdiction of the English Courts.

 

 

 

 

 

 TERMS AND CONDITIONS

 

Definitions

means the signature page, the Term Sheet (Part 1) including any annexes attached thereto, the Terms and Conditions (Part 2), and any other documents incorporated by reference;

means malware, spyware, trap doors, back doors, time bombs, logic bombs, worms trojan horses and any other parasitic program or programming code written intentionally to enter a computer platform or computer network without the user’s permission or knowledge, which is intended to damage, modify or disrupt the operation of software or hardware;

the POC Contract T&Cs, the POC Contract and any drafts thereof, the existence and contents of this Agreement and any and all information or know how about TechPassport or the Company (including about systems, security, procedures, products, business strategy, facilities, people, disputes under this Agreement) in whatever form, whether tangible or intangible, and whether disclosed before or after the date of this Agreement;

any circumstances which occur and which are beyond the reasonable control of a party and directly prevent that party from performing its obligations under this Agreement including war, civil commotion, armed conflict, riot, act of terrorism, fire, flood or other act of God (excluding any labour dispute labour shortages, strikes or lock-outs);

Means in relation to the provision of the services  provided under this Agreement and any ancillary performance obligations, the provision of such services or the performance of such obligations using the highest degree of skill, care, prudence, supervision, diligence, foresight, quality control and quality management which would (at the relevant time) be adopted by a leading professional supplier of such services;

The period set out in the Term Sheet;

"IPR"

means all present and future rights conferred by statute, common law or equity in any territory in or in relation to copyright and related moral rights, patent, trade marks, designs, topographies, database rights (and the right to extract information from databases), circuit layouts, business and domain names, inventions, inventions, , rights in goodwill or to sue for passing off and all other similar rights or equivalent rights or forms of protection whether or not registered (or capable of being registered) and all applications (and rights to  apply) therefor, and for renewals and extensions of any such rights as may now or in the future exist anywhere in the world;

“Package”

means a selection of Services as described in the Term Sheet;

 

“Personal Data”

personal data (as defined by the GDPR) in respect of which TechPassport or the Customer is primarily responsible and/or accountable under Data Protection Legislation;

 

“Personal Data Breach”

The accidental or unlawful destruction, loss, alteration, corruption, unauthorised disclosure of, or access to, Personal Data transmitted, stored or otherwise processed;

 

“Platform”

Means:

  1. (a)the software developed and/or used by TechPasport which is deployed on the equipment referred to in paragraph (b) of this definion and made available for access  to Company Users; and 

  2. (b)all computer hardware, software, consumables, operating systems, firmware, telecommunications networking, routing, cabling, power supplies, electrical or other infrastructure equipment that is used as a platform for hosting the Software and Data and which are accessed and used (directly or indirectly) by Users through such equipment. 

“POC Contract”

means a contract between the Company and a Customer for the evaluation of the Company’s products and/or services agreed via the Platform;

“POC Contract T&Cs”

Means the terms and conditions set out in Appendix A to these Terms and Conditions which may be updated from time to time in accordance with clause Changes to Terms and Conditions;

“Services”

means the services relating the applicable Package as described in the Term Sheet and the Documentation;

"Term"

means the term of this Agreement as set out in Appendix 1;

“Term Sheet”

The term sheet in Part 1 of this Agreement; and

“Working Day”

means Monday to Friday inclusive but excluding bank and other public holidays in England and Wales.

Scope

    1. 2.1This Agreement is between TechPassport and the Company and sets out the conditions with respect to the Company’s use of the Services.   

Term

This Agreement shall commence on the Commencement Date and shall, unless terminated earlier, continue until the end of the Initial Term.  At the end of the Initial Term, this Agreement shall renew for successive twelve-month periods unless terminated by either party by giving at least three months’ notice prior to the expiry of the Initial Term or any renewal term, or (ii) by either party in accordance with the terms of the Agreement.

3.2         Termination by the Company in accordance with clause This Agreement shall commence on the Commencement Date and shall, unless terminated earlier, continue until the end of the Initial Term. At the end of the Initial Term, this Agreement shall renew for successive twelve-month periods unless terminated by either party by giving at least three months’ notice prior to the expiry of the Initial Term or any renewal term, or (ii) by either party in accordance with the terms of the Agreement. prior to the expiry of the Initial Term or renewal term as the case may be shall not entitle the Company to a refund of any Charges.  

Use of the Platform

TechPassport grants to the Company:

A non-exclusive, worldwide, royalty-free right to permit Company Users to use the Services and the Documentation for the Term in accordance with the terms and conditions of this Agreement.

Non-exclusive, perpetual, worldwide, irrevocable and royalty-free right for Company to use the Service Outputs in accordance with terms and conditions of this Agreement.

The licence granted under clause TechPassport grants to the Company: is subject to the following:

The Company and the Company Users may only use the Platform and Service Outputs for the Company’s own internal business purposes;

The POC Contract, once signed, is subject to any additional restrictions agreed under the POC Contract and such restrictions shall apply as between the Company and the Customer;

The Company will only use the POC Contract T&Cs for entering into POC Contracts via the Platform and shall not change the POC Contract T&Cs other than the Schedule to the POC Contract;

The Customer Data and IPR in the Services shall only be used by the Company for the purposes of using the Platform to create a POC Contract.  

The number of Company Users shall not exceed the maximum number of Company Users and Product listings set out in the Term Sheet.

 

Any subsidiary or holding company of the Company is required to enter into a separate access agreement before becoming entitled to use the Platform for the purposes of entering into a POC Contract notwithstanding it relates to the evaluation of the same product and/or service offered by the Company via the Platform.

The Company shall be responsible, at its own expense, for its internal and external telecommunications systems, networks, any internet connection, hardware, mobile devices or other systems or other systems or software to access the Platform.  

The Company acknowledges and agrees that the Platform is a multi-tenanted and nothing in this Agreement creates an exclusive supply arrangement or prevents TechPassport from supplying the Services to a third party.  

Password Management and Security

The Company will be identified as a primary account owner for the use of the Services.  The Company may use its primary owner credentials to create other owner accounts, admin accounts and standard user accounts for any Company User.  The Company shall be responsible for creating, modifying and disabling Company User accounts.  The Company shall supply authorised individuals with passports, login details and such other information as may be reasonably required to enable such authorised individual to access and use the Services in the manner contemplated by this Agreement as Company Users.  

The Company shall take adequate organisational measures to ensure that the respective User log-in are used exclusively by the Users.  The Company shall, and shall ensure that Users, keep their respective User password are protected, kept secret and not disclosed to any third party.  The Company shall immediately inform TechPassport if it cbecomes aware of any non-eligible person has access to or knowledge of any passport or accesses the Platfrom.

TechPassport may prevent any person from accessing the platform and may take such adequate measures as TechPassport deems necessary to prevent such access if TechPassport becomes aware of any circumstances which give reason to believe that any User log-ins have been misused.

Company Obligations

The Company shall perform its obligations under this Agreement and use the Services in accordance and compliance with (i) the terms of this Agreement; (ii) TechPassport’s instructions;  and (iii) all applicable laws and regulation (and so as not to do anything that would cause TechPassport or the Customer to be in breach of any applicable laws and regulations).

The Company shall provide TechPassport such information, data and documents as it may reasonably require in order to perform the Services.

Warranties

The Company undertakes, warrants and represents that:

it shall not, and shall procure all Company Users to not, re-transmit, store, sell, deal or transfer, or otherwise make available to any third party the Customer Data and POC Contract T&Cs (other than to Customers who have initiated a POC request) or use for any reason other than as permitted by this Agreement.

it will not attempt to change the POC Contract T&Cs;

It will keep all Company details up to date on the Platform, including registered office address.  

      1. 1.1.1.It will comply with the Platform Acceptable Use Policy;   

it has all necessary authorisations, consents, permissions and/or licences required to enable it to enter into POC Contract for the testing of the Company Products;

the Descriptions accurately describe the relevant Company Products;

it will not use the Platform for any anti-competitive behaviour, bribery or corruption, insider trading, posting defamatory information or any other act or omission which does not comply with applicable law;

perform its obligations under the Agreement in a timely and professional manner and in accordance with Good Industry Practice;

it shall not introduce a Computer Virus on the Platform;

it will comply with industry best IT security practices when administrating log-ins and passwords; and

it shall, at its own expense, procure adequate policies of insurance in respect of the Company’s relevant potential liabilities arising out of or in connection with all POC Contracts it enters into and shall comply with furnish evidence as TechPassport may reasonably request to demonstrate that the insurance has been procured and maintained in force.  

The Company shall indemnify TechPassport against any and all liability, loss, damage, costs (including full legal fees), and other expenses that TechPassport incurs or suffers as a result of any action or claim that is brought against TechPassport arising from the Company’s breach of clause.

Intellectual Property

The Company shall not use the TechPassport name or logo (including any trade marks) in any of its advertising or publicity material without TechPassports prior written consent (which in the case of trade marks shall be by way of separate trade mark licence), which may be withheld or given in TechPassport’s absolute discretion.

The Company Data provided to TechPassport by the Company are and shall remain the Company’s property and TechPassport shall not obtain any right, title or interest in them.

The Company grants to TechPassport the non-exclusive right to use the Company Data to the extent necessary to provide the Services to the Company or Company Group Members.  The Company Data may be viewable to Customers on the Platform and incorporated into the POC Contract which may be used for Customers’ internal business use and record keeping purposes.

Save for the Company Data, the IPR in the Services are and shall remain vested in TechPassport.  

TechPassport shall indemnify the Company against any and all liability, loss, damage, costs (including full legal fees), and other expenses that Company incurs or suffers as a result of any action or claim that is brought against Company arising from its use of any Services under this Agreement provided:

that such use is in accordance with the terms of this Agreement;

the Company notifies TechPassport in writing of any claim of which it has notice;

not make any admission of liability or agree to any settlement or compromise any claim without the prior written consent of TechPassport; and

at TechPassport’s request and expense, give TechPassport all reasonable assistance in connection with the investigation, negotiation and resolution of the claim.

Charges and Payment

The Company shall pay the Charges in accordance with this Clause Charges and Payment and the Term Sheet.

The Company shall pay any undisputed invoices within 30 days of the date of the invoice.

All sums payable under this Agreement exclude value-added tax or any relevant local sales taxes, which the Company shall apply according to relevant local regulations.  TechPassport shall provide a valid value-added tax or local sales tax invoice.

TechPassport shall be entitled to increase the Charges at the expirty of the Initial Period and every twelve months thereafter by a maximum of the amount of the percentage increase in the UK Retail Price Index over the preceding 12 months by providing written notice to the Company.

The Company may upgrade to a higher Package through the Package options on the Platform.  Should the  Company select a higher Package during the Initial Term or any renewal term, the Company shall pay the difference in fees between the lower Package and higher Package for the pro-rated period of the Initial Term or the subsequent renewal term as the case may be.

Liability

Neither party shall be liable to the other in tort (including negligence), breach of contract, breach of statutory duty or otherwise due to, under and/or arising out of or in connection with this Agreement for any loss of profits, revenues, loss of business or anticipated savings (in each cease whether direct or indirect), or for any loss or damage which is consequential, punitive, special or indirect, in each case whether or not it had been advised of the likelihood of any such loss or damage.

Subject to clause No limit on or exclusion of liability shall apply under this Agreement to: (i) claims relating to death or personal injury; (ii) any claims relating to regulatory breaches; (iii) claims of theft, fraud or fraudulent misrepresentation;, the liability of TechPassport to the Company under or in connection with this Agreement whether arising in tort (including negligence), breach of contract, breach of statuory duty or otherwise shall, in aggregate not exceed the greater of:

Five thousand pounds (£5,000.00); and

100% of the Charges paid and payable under this Agreement in the calendar year in which the cause of action arose.

No limit on or exclusion of liability shall apply under this Agreement to:  (i) claims relating to death or personal injury; (ii) any claims relating to regulatory breaches; (iii) claims of theft, fraud or fraudulent misrepresentation; (iv) any breach of the obligations set out in clause Confidentiality (Confidentiality), or any liability under the indemnity granted in clause TechPassport shall indemnify the Company against any and all liability, loss, damage, costs (including full legal fees), and other expenses that Company incurs or suffers as a result of any action or claim that is brought against Company arising from its use of any Services under this Agreement provided: (Intellectual Property Rights) and clause The Company shall indemnify TechPassport against any and all liability, loss, damage, costs (including full legal fees), and other expenses that TechPassport incurs or suffers as a result of any action or claim that is brought against TechPassport arising from the Company’s breach of clause. (Warranties); and (v) any other liability which cannot be lawfully excluded or limited.

Whilst the Platform assists with the creation of the POC Contract, the POC Contract comprises a separate legal agreement between the Company and the Customer and TechPassport has no liability under the POC Contract including with respect to either the Company’s or the Customer’s acts or omissions.  

Neither party shall be liable to the other for any failure to fulfil obligations caused by a Force Majeure Event.

Confidentiality

Each party shall:

Keep confidential all Confidential Information and only use it as necessary to perform this Agreement; and

Only disclose to any third party Confidential Information if expressly permitted by this Agreement and the third party has signed a suitable confidentiality agreement

The foregoing obligations shall not apply however:

to information which is or later comes into the public domain otherwise than through an act or omission of the Recipient; or

to information which was already known to the Recipient at the time of disclosure otherwise by an unauthorised disclosure by a third party; or

where disclosure of information is required by law, order of court, the requirements of any regulatory authority or taxation authority or the rules of any stock exchange; or

where the Recipient has the prior written consent of the Provider to so use or disclose the information.

Each party may disclose information to its employees, professional advisors, agents and subcontractors solely on a need-to-know basis provided that it procures that the person to whom such disclosure is made complies with the obligations under this clause Confidentiality as if it were a party to the Agreement.

Confidential Information comprising the POC negotiations, draft POC Contracts and the signed POC Contract may be disclosed by either party to the relevant Customer.  TechPassport shall procure all Customers accessing the Platform to agree to keep such documents and information confidential as set out in this clause Confidentiality.  

Delay

The Company acknowledges the importance with respect to its timely response to Customers and reviewing and responding to draft POC Contracts on the Platform (“Response”).  The Company shall promptly respond to Customer queries and complete the pre-contract steps in a timely manner.

If the Company becomes aware of any actual or potential delay with respect to issuing any Response it will immediately advise TechPassport.  

The Company shall take all reasonable steps to minimise the impact on the its delay.  

In addition to any other remedy available under the Agreement, TechPassport shall be entitled to suspend or remove the Company and/or any Company Product from the Platform if the Company has not complied with this clause 12.

Termination

Notwithstanding anything else in this Agreement either party may terminate this Agreement by notice in writing to the other party at any time with immediate effect.

Notwithstanding anything else contained in it, this Agreement may be terminated:

by TechPassport immediately by giving notice in writing to the Company if:

  1. i.The Company shall (or shall threaten to) sell, assign, part with or cease to carry on its business or that part of its business relating to the development of the use of the Platform; or 

  2. ii.the control (as defined for the purposes of Section 416 of the Income and Corporation Taxes Act 1988) of the Company shall be transferred to any person or persons other than the person or persons in control of the Company at the date of this Agreement (but the Software Owner shall only be entitled to terminate within the period of 60 days after the Software Owner shall have been notified in writing of the change in control); 

by TechPassport by giving notice in writing to the Company if any of the following occur:

      1. a.i.[INSERT] 

by either party immediately by giving notice in writing to the other if:

      1. a.ii.the other party commits any material or persistent breach of any term of this Agreement and (in the case of a breach capable of being remedied) shall have failed, within fifteen (15) days after the receipt of a request in writing from the other party so to do, to remedy the breach (such request to contain a warning of such party’s intention to terminate); or 

      2. a.iii.the other party has a receiver or administrative receiver appointed of it or over any part of its undertaking or assets or passes a resolution for winding up (otherwise than for the purpose of a bona fide scheme of solvent amalgamation or reconstruction) or a court of competent jurisdiction makes an order to that effect or if the other party enters into any voluntary arrangement with its creditors or becomes subject to an administration order. 

Consequences of Termination

Termination of the Agreement for whatever reason shall not prejudice any accrued rights or liabilities of either party nor shall it affect the coming into force or the continuance in force of any provision hereof which is expressly or by implication intended to come into or continue in force on or after such termination.

Termination of this Agreement shall not affect any POC Contract and POC Contracts shall continue in full force and effect in accordance with its terms and conditions.

Upon termination of this Agreement, the Supplier shall no longer have the right to use the Platform and shall immediately cease all use of:

the Platform; and

all use of the POC T&Cs save for its own record keeping purposes for existing POC Contracts.

Data Protection

Each party warrants in respect of any Personal Data that it may receive, obtain, create or process in connection with the Platform or this Agreement, that it will:

comply with all relevant Data Protection Legislation;

only process Personal Data as strictly necessary for the purposes of this Agreement (and in the case of Customer Personal Data, the Company shall only use such Personal Data for communicating with the Customer for the purposes of entering into a POC Contract, use of the Platform and in accordance with the reasonable instructions of TechPassport and/or the relevant Customer if applicable);

not permit any other party (including any sub-contractor) to process any Personal Data without having obtained prior written consent from the other party;

maintain and to provide to the other party upon request an accurate up-to-date written record of processing activities carried out in respect of Personal Data in a format which meets the requirements of the Data Protection Legislation and the reasonable requirements of the requesting party;

maintain strict and adequate security, technical and organisational measures in accordance with the relevant Data Protection Legislation in order to maintain the integrity and confidentiality of the Personal Data whilst in its possession to ensure that the Personal Data shall not be recorded, processed, deleted, disclosed, lost damaged, altered, used or otherwise tampered with in an unauthorised, accidental or unlawful manner.

The Company warrants in respect of any Personal Data that it may receive, obtain, create or process in connection with the Platform or this Agreement, that it will:

comply with TechPassport’s reasonable instructions with respect to any registration and/or notification requirements, correspondence with any regulatory authority and any communication with a Data Subject;

promptly notify TechPassport in writing if it receives any communication from a Data Subject or a Regulatory Authority regarding the processing of the Personal Data and shall provide co-operation and assistance to TechPassport in respect of the same; and

acknowledges and agrees that any transfer of Customer Personal Data received in connection with a POC is subject to the POC Contract;

In the event of a Data Breach Event the Company shall:

promptly (and in any event within forty-eight (48) hours) notify TechPassport in writing of the Data Breach Event including in such notice all information reasonably required by TechPassport to comply with its obligation under the Data Protection Legislation;  

provide, at the request of TechPassport, co-operation, assistance and/or all information reasonably required by TechPassport to comply with Data Protection Legislation and/or responding to any communication from a Data Subject or regulatory authority;

comply with TechPassport’s reasonable instructions;

provide TechPassport with a copy of all Personal Data it holds in relation to the affected Data Subject(s) upon TechPassport’s request; and

without prejudice to any other right or remedy of TechPassport or Group Company, the Company shall undertake promptly to remedy the breach (or the circumstances giving rise to the breach) without charge and at no additional cost to TechPassport or the Group Company.

The Company shall fully indemnify and keep indemnified TechPassport and Group Companies against all Losses arising out of or in connection with a Data Breach.  Assignment and Contracting.

Anti-Bribery and Corruption

In connection with this Agreement, each party warrants and represents that:

it shall comply with and shall ensure that its Representatives are aware of and comply with Anti-bribery Legislation; and

it, nor to its knowledge, any of its Representatives are, (i) currently under actual or threatened investigation, inquiry or audit by any government authority in relation to any potential offence involving fraud, bribery, corruption or dishonestly, (ii) have been convicted or pleaded guilty to an offence involving fraud, bribery, corruption or dishonesty; or (iii) the target of economic or financial sanctions measures imposed by the United Nations, the European Union, the United Kingdom, the United States or any relevant and applicable jurisdiction; and

it shall not, and shall ensure its Representatives shall not, act or make any omissions that would cause the other party or any Customer to be in violation of any applicable Anti-bribery Legislation.

Assignment

Neither party shall assign any of its rights or obligations under this Agreement without the other party’s prior written consent, not to be unreasonably withheld or delayed.

Changes to Terms and Conditions

TechPassport has the right to change these Terms and Conditions by providing the Company at least thirty (30) days’ notice in writing provided such changes apply all users of the Platform which offer Products for POCs. Upon receipt of such notice, the Company has the right to terminate this Agreement by providing TechPassport with written notice within such thirty day notice period.  If requested by the Company in writing stipulating its nominated bank account, TechPassport shall pay a pro-rated refund for any pre-paid Charges if the effective date of termination is prior to the expiry of the Initial Term or the then-current renewal term.

Relationship and Third Parties

Other than the relevant Customer with respect to Company’s misuse of Customer Data, this Agreement does not create or infer any rights under the Contracts (Rights of Third Parties) Act 1999 which are enforceable by any person who is not a party to this Agreement.

General

Neither party will be liable for delay in performing its obligations or for failure to perform its obligations if the delay or failure results from circumstances beyond its reasonable control and is not attributable to its wilful acts, neglect or failure to take reasonable precautions, including acts of God, governmental action, flood, fire, explosion, accident, war, acts of terrorism or civil commotion.

If either party needs to give the other notice under this agreement it must do so in writing and provide it to the other party at their usual place of business (which will be deemed to have been delivered 48 hours after despatch) or via electronic means  (which  shall be deemed to have been received on the first Working Day following its despatch).

No failure to exercise nor any delay in exercising by any party to this Agreement of any right, power, privilege or remedy under this Agreement shall impair or operate as a waiver thereof.

Nothing in this Agreement shall constitute, or be deemed to constitute, a partnership between the parties nor, except as expressly provided, shall it constitute, or be deemed to constitute, any party the agent of any other party for any purpose.

Any amendment or variation to this Agreement shall only be made by prior written agreement between the parties.

The unenforceability of any single provision of the Agreement shall not affect any other provision thereof. Where such a provision is held to be unenforceable, the parties shall use their best endeavours to negotiate and agree upon an enforceable provision which achieves to the greatest extent possible the economic, legal and commercial objectives of the unenforceable provision.

The headings to the Clauses and sections of these terms and conditions are for ease of reference only and shall not affect the interpretation or construction of the Agreement.

This Agreement and any appendices and documents referred to herein constitutes the entire understanding between the parties with respect to the subject matter hereof and supersedes all prior oral or written communications, agreements or understandings between the parties, save where a fraudulent representation has been made.

In the event of any conflict of inconsistency between the Term Sheet and the Terms and Conditions, the Terms and Conditions shall prevail.

This Agreement may be executed in any number of counterparts, which shall together constitute one Agreement.  Any party may enter into this Agreement by signing any such counterpart. The parties agree and consent to the use of electronic signatures solely for the purposes of executing this Agreement or any variation or related transactional document.  Such electronic signature shall be deemed to have the same full and binding effect as a hand written signature.
